page.title: 17An Old Hedgerow
page.content: In the grounds of Bridge Farm School is an old hedegrow.It separates the school orchard,which was retained when the estate was developed,from the playing field.It runs north to south and has a disused ditch on the west side.It is approximately 146m long and on average 2.64m wide and 5.6m high.No management has occurred for at least 15 years and many trees have become established,the tallest being a 6.5m elm.The hedgerow is approximately 800 years old on the basis of 1 species per 100 years.These are:elm,hawthorn, blackthorn,field maple,dogwood,elder, privet and wild rose,with the first two being dominant. Several types of climbing plant scramble up the hedge and many wild flowers grow in it.It provides food and shelter for various species of birds,insects and small animals.
